results.title: I am Joe's spine
results.brief_description: Uses three-dimensional animation and live sequences to provide an understanding of the complexity of the spine’s construction and an awareness of what can happen when the spine and its surrounding muscles are not given proper care.

results.title: I am Joe's heart. - Rev. ed.
results.brief_description: Uses animation and live action to show the effects of lack of exercise, heavy smoking, and overindulgence in fatty foods and alcohol on the heart. Shows how the heart and circulatory system function and stresses exercise and healthful living.

results.title: I am Joe's heart
results.brief_description: While the camera follows Joe through a typical American business man’s day, his heart speaks out about what Joe is doing to it. Animation in a machinery metaphor illustrates the heart’s functions and the effects upon it of anxiety, tension, smoking, faulty diet and overweight. Joe’s heart attack and a coronary shutdown are detailed along with the step-by-step lifesaving procedures in an Intensive Care Unit. While Joe’s recovery lessens the fear of the fatality of a heart attack his experience brings home a lesson that can prevent heart attacks from happening.

results.title: I am how I look
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Feelings”.
Explores how children view their physical selves and how that relates to the whole self-image. Includes children describing how they look, the importance of differences for helping one develop a sense of self-identity and specific suggestions for liking oneself better. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

group_siblings.title: I am what I know
group_siblings.creator_credit: Glenda Fillinger, Paul Fillinger and Churchill Films

results.title: I am how I feel
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Feelings”.
One of a series of three films dealing with the question “Who am I?”. Presents a series of sketches about the expression of feelings. Ways of handling negative feelings and achieving more positive feelings are shown. All people have the same basic emotions but respond differently in particular situations. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: I am here today (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A record of how 21 children aged 5, 6 and 7 interacted with each other as they made various things in the playroom. The children were from the same class, growing and changing together in the classroom since the previous September. Filmed in May 1969. A film study for teachers.

results.title: I am Fijian
results.brief_description: A look at the diversity of customs, traditions and religions of Fiji. Some of them have remained virtually unchanged, like the Hindu religious ritual of fire walking, or the Kava Ceremony. Others have been adapted or modified by western influences such as the Polynesian wedding, or a Fijian funeral service. Narrated by Peter Gwynne.

results.title: I am an old tree
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Michael Rubbo
results.brief_description: A picture of life in Cuba by a filmmaker who believes in getting into people’s lives and letting ideas seep out of what he finds. Among the people shown are a doctor who came back to Cuba, a high-school student whose school-based radio-assembly work and classes last until 10:00 p.m., and a tobacco farmer who now owns his land. For all of them the new Cuba has done much and promises more.

results.title: I am an engineer
results.brief_description: Intended to stimulate interest in power electrical engineering, this film presents a series of electro-magnetic phenomena on a “why is it so” basis. Professor Eric Laithwaite (electrical engineer) of the Imperial College, London discusses several aspects of work being done, particularly in the field of electro-magnetically propelled vehicles.
